text:
Hello all, I have tried to find an issue similar to this but haven’t had luck on this particular issue:

We have a HubDB table and we are pulling data from that table to display on a landing page.

Sometimes, when we add items to the table, the page pulling the data is updating just fine. Other times, the page never updates with the new items. It isn’t automatically clearing the cache as far as I can tell. It’s not even a matter of waiting – the cache doesn’t update even after several hours or even a full day.

any thoughts?
Did u face this issue today or in the past?

What is the best practice to reference an `<img>`  source path within a template file?

```(A)
<img src="{% get_asset_url('../images/logo.png')%}">

(B)
<img src="../images/logo.png">

(C)
<img src="<https://absolute-path-to-file-via-file-manager-reference.com/123456/img.png>">```
You can rule out C, I know that much :slightly_smiling_face:
okay, it didn't like the last 2 closing curly braces on different lines. odd.

Why is that? Referring to the CDN URL of a file in the File Manager seems to have worked in my test.

So just wondering which is the best practice.

Anyone have any best practice documentation links for this?
